techmeme.title: Google says its test removing European news content for 1% of users in eight EU countries found that there was no change to Search ad revenue due to the removal (Paul Liu/The Keyword)
DoorDash partners with Klarna to offer payment plans, including credit options for purchases of $35 or more; Grubhub also uses Klarna as a payment option (Gael Cooper/CNET)
Sources: Katie Haun is raising $1B across two new crypto-focused funds as her Haun Ventures is close to deploying most of the $1.5B raised in 2022 (Leo Schwartz/Fortune)
StubHub files for an IPO, with plans to list on the NYSE, and reports a $2.8M loss on $1.77B in revenue in 2024, vs. a $405M profit on $1.37B in revenue in 2023 (Dan Primack/Axios)
Perplexity proposes to buy TikTok, says it wants to open source the algorithm and that it is "singularly positioned to rebuild" it "without creating a monopoly" (Kylie Robison/The Verge)
